1.text: Dead flies cause a perfumer’s perfume To send forth a stink; The precious by reason of wisdom—By reason of honour—a little folly!

2.text: The heart of the wise is at his right hand, And the heart of a fool at his left.

3.text: And also, when he that is a fool Is walking in the way, his heart is lacking, And he hath said to every one, ‘He is a fool.’

4.text: If the spirit of the ruler go up against thee, Thy place leave not, For yielding quieteth great sinners.

5.text: There is an evil I have seen under the sun, As an error that goeth out from the ruler,

6.text: He hath set the fool in many high places, And the rich in a low place do sit.

7.text: I have seen servants on horses, And princes walking as servants on the earth.

8.text: Whoso is digging a pit falleth into it, And whoso is breaking a hedge, a serpent biteth him.

9.text: Whoso is removing stones is grieved by them, Whoso is cleaving trees endangered by them.

10.text: If the iron hath been blunt, And he the face hath not sharpened, Then doth he increase strength, And wisdom is advantageous to make right.

11.text: If the serpent biteth without enchantment, Then there is no advantage to a master of the tongue.

12.text: Words of the mouth of the wise are gracious, And the lips of a fool swallow him up.

13.text: The beginning of the words of his mouth is folly, And the latter end of his mouth Is mischievous madness.

14.text: And the fool multiplieth words: ‘Man knoweth not that which is, And that which is after him, who doth declare to him?’

15.text: The labour of the foolish wearieth him, In that he hath not known to go unto the city.

16.text: Woe to thee, O land, when thy king is a youth, And thy princes do eat in the morning.

17.text: Happy art thou, O land, When thy king is a son of freemen, And thy princes do eat in due season, For might, and not for drunkenness.

18.text: By slothfulness is the wall brought low, And by idleness of the hands doth the house drop.

19.text: For mirth they are making a feast, And wine maketh life joyful, And the silver answereth with all.

20.text: Even in thy mind a king revile not, And in the inner parts of thy bed-chamber Revile not the rich: For a fowl of the heavens causeth the voice to go, And a possessor of wings declareth the word.
